website_summaries.verdict: A superior car radio antenna that provides exceptional sound quality and can withstand strong winds.
pros: Boasts a sealed rubber exterior that guarantees the antenna will serve you well consistently
Forty-inch antenna is sold with a universal plug-in
cons: Overall construction leaves much to be desired
Delivers subpar signal quality in many cities and towns

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my motorcycle!
customer_reviews.text: This antaenna works really well inside of my batwing fairing on my bike! I'm in a pretty urban area so most of the signals aren't coming from very far away but I am hey happy to not have to run wires for an antenna..
customer_reviews.author: Carramrod

customer_reviews.title: Try this one out in your RV
customer_reviews.text: My original Radio RV Antenna was awful - it was just a ribbon cable tucked down between to RV front cap and interior wall. So I thought what the heck I will try this soft wire antenna as a replacement for my ribbon cable. Wow! This little flex wire antenna works fantastic. I get great FM radio reception 80 miles away from LA broadcasting stations in the middle of the desert. And there are no holes to drill or ugly external radio antenna masts.
customer_reviews.author: The Baron

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as an external antenna on my boat.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want an external antenna on my boat so I got this cable and plugged it into the radio, then ran the wire on the underside of the gunnel. It picks up local radio like my car. I'm please with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Richw

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy construction, short
customer_reviews.text: It works...kinda. But there was frayed wires sticking out and the rubber tip fell off just taking it out of the packaging. Also, the cable is super short so don't plan on running this out anywhere to get better reception. Ultimately it wasn't even worth my time to return, I just threw it away and got a different solution.
customer_reviews.author: Batman97045

customer_reviews.title: AM Reception is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Installed on recommendation from dealer. Easy to install as it simply plugs into the back of the radio. The receiving end is a single wire with the last 1/2" cut back to expose the metallic wire. FM reception is perfectly clear while AM reception, not unlike other antennas, remains staticky with plenty of interference. Admittedly, AM reception in general is subject to environmental interference so I would say this antenna is no better, nor necessarily any worse than other antennas.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: Not for cars apparently.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this in a car, but it did not receive am or fm stations with it was plugged in. The reception was the same with it unplugged. I tried it out prior to putting the radio back in the dash luckily. It might work for a boat as described, but it did not work in a car.
customer_reviews.author: Nick N.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like leaving feedback that is not completely positive, but I wanted to share my experience with this antenna. I live in an area where most of the am and fm stations are somewhat remote. The factory antenna on my car just wasn't getting the job done. Based on some of the reviews of this product, I thought I give it a try. It was worse than my factory antenna. I tried it on its on, it didn't work. I hooked it up with my factory antenna, still no help. Fortunately it didn't cost that much.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great - was not able to pick up any radio stations while on the lake and now I can pick up all of them clearly. Just have it laid out flat in a side pocket with no special mounting.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Works only if you are close to strong stations
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I am not convinced that it works well for my application -- on a boat located in the mountains and about 30 miles from the transmitters. Easy to install, best when you HAVE to hide the antenna and can't drill holes. Revised after using the boat. This works only if you boat near (less than 10 miles over flat terrain) the radio stations you listen to. It is simply not long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dadeo

customer_reviews.title: Can you hear me now?
customer_reviews.text: ‘Durability‘ isn’t a valued attribute for a hidden antenna. Signal quality and reception is. This antenna works okay, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Got less stations then stock antenna, tried everything inside outside wrapped it around the length of my stock antenna, stuck it around my windshield inside and out WORSE THEN STOCK.if anyone knows of anything that DOES work, please share it me because I am sick of buying junk
customer_reviews.author: Perry Fortin

customer_reviews.title: It works in our 1970's Cadillac.
customer_reviews.text: I took away one star because the length of the cable is quite short. The product works to a relative degree.. that is.. relatively effective. I'm not sure about you but we don't use the 'radio' much and this product served the purpose of foregoing the factory antenna on our 1970's stereo. [I didn't want to disable the factory products so our car would remain stock but needed a modern receiver unit with all functions.] Simple to install and it works just fine for our old car.
customer_reviews.author: Will B.

customer_reviews.title: If anything it may have gotten a little worse. In all fairness
customer_reviews.text: Didn't improve my signal. If anything it may have gotten a little worse. In all fairness, it may not be the antennas fault. For some reason I expected it to be longer. FYI... the entire length of the antenna ***including plug*** is 40"
customer_reviews.author: BradTheNailer

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.  Static
customer_reviews.text: All static. Not a clear channel. Lesson learned again Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Horrible reception. Antenna is mounted inside a plastic roof ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible reception. Antenna is mounted inside a plastic roof console on my golf cart. Roof console is covered by a plastic roof. There is no metal around it. Antenna will bring in one station. Worthless Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Huge improvement over no antenna. I ran it along some pre existing wires in the hull
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** Worked very well. Definitely beats drilling holes when not needed. I'm sure the signal would be better with a traditional antenna, but this did the trick for my use! Haven't tested to see if it works yet but I will update if it has an issue. Anytime I don't have to drill another hole in my boat, I'm automatically assuming a 5 star rating is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me at all.
customer_reviews.text: Product was worse than stock antenna. Could not pick up any reception at all at least with stock antenna I could get some stations with a little static
customer_reviews.author: jay77

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me but it might work for you good luck
customer_reviews.author: C-Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great and was bought for a cheap price !
customer_reviews.author: james johnston

customer_reviews.title: Picks up fm decent
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Not as good as mast antenna but we all know that
customer_reviews.author: William costa

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this item internally for a boombox I built. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: TDB

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good antenna for a boat. The channels (even the good ones) eventually fade out for just a second and then back in again every so often. I'm fine with it, as we don't blast the radio. At a comfortable listening level you don't hardly notice. Of any antenna i have seen on other boats, this one works just as good.
customer_reviews.author: ben smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I needed an antenna for a radio that needed to be replaced on a sailboat... No FM antenna on the previous radio.. this one fit perfectly and enabled excellent reception.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gold

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna for in-dash installation
customer_reviews.text: I installed this wire antenna in our walk-around fishing boat. I didn't want to drill a hole and have an external antenna for the rare times that I listen to the radio, so this was an ideal solution for my application. I have the antenna extended under the dash area, and it receives fairly well within 5-10 miles of shore.
customer_reviews.author: TrentAJ

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the radio in my 2000 Dodge Caravan because the reception with the stock antenna was poor. I installed this antenna and reception was non-existent. I guess the bottom line is that I found out that this antenna may or may not work for your application. Naturally it was simple to return. So not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: HateTheCold

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says its supposed to do!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lewis

customer_reviews.title: easy install
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is mounted in the overhead wiring of my boat. It does a pretty decent job of getting the stronger channels. I mostly need it to pick up the signal from my fm modulator so that is no problem. If you have strong channels in your area and don't want a regular antenna I would give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Dana E. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk. I got better reception with an old antenna than this thing. Not worth you money.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt S

customer_reviews.title: Just get this one, don't bother with the other cheap antennas.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this first! I unplugged my first antenna choice, and plugged this in and RIGHT AWAY picked up stations. Even after I hid it in my headliner, it still was getting full stereo FM with good quieting. Sure it's just a wire cut to length at the end of a bit of coax with a connector on it, but you're paying under $10 for it, and it just works!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: A racoon got into my boat and among other things (seats) shredded my radio wiring including the antenna. I replace the original with this antenna. It works perfectly! Great item at a great price. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: craig roth

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for me. Put it in my boat took all the static out of the stations I got and wanted. More expensive looking one that was being used wasn't even as good as this one. Probably depends on your area but sure did the trick for me. It was cheep so thought I would try it before buying one with aerial and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: MJV

customer_reviews.title: Works Pretty Well
customer_reviews.text: For the inexpensive price I have no complaints. Its a huge improvement over no antenna at all for my marine radio thats mounted in an outdoor BBQ Island. Now I get most stations and a few AM. Eventually I may buy a superior antenna but I will have to spend a lot more money, happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: This product has worked well in my boat for the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked well in my boat for the past 2 years, I would buy it again. When I was re-doing the stereo in my Jeep, I tried this antenna and it picked up just as many stations as the original mast antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Luke G Records

customer_reviews.title: Harley Fairing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this antenna to put inside of a Harley fairing and works very well. I am able to get all of the radio stations that my car antenna is able to pick up and the antenna is all inside... no part of it is exposed!
customer_reviews.author: David T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!! DON'T DO IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS OVER-PRICED JUNK!!! A piece of #12 copper wire works much better!
customer_reviews.author: Donn55

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Just an antenna wire but gives great radio reception in Seattle puget sound area.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Antenna
customer_reviews.text: good product for the price could stand to be a little longer and mabe get a little more reception then it would be a very nice product
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Mounted right up, used in my UTV for am/fm can get all stations now. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It' got some static
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works but it also transmits a lot of static to the speakers. I have another antenna like this one that works much better but I don't know what brand it is, wish I could figure it out so I could get another one.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: absolute junk... I plugged it in, didn't pick up a single channel... even channels that are strong anywhere else
customer_reviews.author: jomiller97

customer_reviews.title: I have this laying behind/under the dash of an old ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this laying behind/under the dash of an old (all-metal) VW bus and am impressed with the stations it pulls in. I really didn't expect much, but it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: fredrok

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quality could be a bit better, but overall its ok.
customer_reviews.author: juanjoselopez1

customer_reviews.title: great value and reception
customer_reviews.text: this little antennas allowed me to receive all the radio stations that my tuner could handle
customer_reviews.author: Guydio

customer_reviews.title: Pay a little bit more for better quality
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get good signal. I had it on my motorcycle and it had no resistance for the signal
customer_reviews.author: 302mustang70

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works excellent for the price. You might second guess this due to the price, but I replaced this on my Jet Boat and the reception is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Nothin too special about this antenna. Too short and reception does not seem that good. Dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Neil

customer_reviews.title: OK, I expected this performance...
customer_reviews.text: Works good with a clear sky, Static if under anything at all.
customer_reviews.author: wyleone

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: FM radio would have a hard time locking on to stations using just a wire. Put this on and perfect. No more stereo static drift.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I Tried
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this under the center console of my boat. It didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: R.Chevalier

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Antenna is consealed in the console of my boat, no unsitly exposed antenna to get in your way. Brings in FM stations very well.
customer_reviews.author: David Philips

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective
customer_reviews.text: For a few bucks my boat stereo went from zero reception to great reception, while on shore anyway. Haven't tested it offshore yet, but for the money and ease of istallation, I'm happy to be able to tune in while docked at lease.
customer_reviews.author: Fotis N Loulourgas

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the telescoping or mast units.
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap but works awesome. Plus you can tuck it away and get rid of your nasty mast or telescoping antenna.
customer_reviews.author: russ silva

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work at all. Total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Joan A Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome antenna for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat it for the price! Installed this antenna inside of a motorcycle fairing and picks up stations from far away.
customer_reviews.author: Harleydrider

customer_reviews.title: Camper Stereo Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my camper for a stereo I just installed. Able to pick up more stations than before.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Banish

customer_reviews.title: great reception
customer_reviews.text: I used this for an ice chest stereo that I made. This antenna give great reception. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. We were very satisfied and would recommend this vendor to others. The experience was positive.
customer_reviews.author: mp59mm

customer_reviews.title: cheap antenna
customer_reviews.text: cheap antenna will do the job. Bought this to use on my car stereo i have set up in my garage, does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Learn

customer_reviews.title: Using it on my Harley
customer_reviews.text: I took the antenna off the back of my Harley, and put this thing inside the fairing. It plugged right into the radio and now my Harley has a slicker look without an antenna sticking out. I'm sure the reception has decreased, I mostly listen to disks or my ipod so really the radio is just a backup.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Biggs

customer_reviews.title: it works perfect
customer_reviews.text: it works perfect have no problems with the antenna I can find any radio station that I have looked for
customer_reviews.author: Henry Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This antenna just worked perfect in my Pyle radio on my boat..
customer_reviews.author: JPDirt

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent radio antenna for applications where a regular mast antenna ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent radio antenna for applications where a regular mast antenna is out of the question. The wire is the optimum length for the FM band of frequencies. I have it coiled inside a portable PA box that has an FM radio. The FM signals are very clean and strong. If you can't or don't want to use a mast antenna and don't want to pay for ridiculously-price "hidden antennas" that are powered, this is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna
customer_reviews.text: I am built a boombox with a car radio and needed an antenna. I initially bought this to cut the cord and attach to a rod-type antenna. much to my surprise this actually got pretty decent reception so I have been using this as my primary antenna. Pretty handy and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: iluvsound

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a Cheap marine AM/FM radio in the sailboat. Living in a rural area signals are always a crap shoot. When I turned it on I have many more channels that the garage radio and was amazed. It does work best when it is totally straight rather and coiled up. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lee

customer_reviews.title: MAW40 Marine Antenna Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works great on my boat's stereo. Good range and no need to extend it, just plug it and enjoy the radio stations.
customer_reviews.author: WR

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Ive built several custom boom-boxes, and I needed a hidden antennae, this worked perfectly. I wish I'd found it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking that maybe it would work on my boat and for just a little money I would try it. I plugged it in and picked up more stations than I could believe. I just ran it through the wiring harness in my boat and I have all the stations in the area. Great product for the money
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Korver

customer_reviews.title: Pulls in some stations, but not the best reception.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this antenna because it was nice and cheap. I also purchased a Tune Trapper and am happier with the Tune Trapper. This other one will just being laying on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: krazykurtk

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This things sucks!!!! Doesn't even pick up local stations!!!! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Hargett

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: supper easy to install, just plug it in, and secure it anywhere on the inside of your center council or anywhere you're installing it. No high profile antennas outside, no holes to drill, simple and efficient works great. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: alen

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this was designed for a boat. But for a car, it didn't work for me. First of all, the cable is way too short, if you are hooking it up on the installed car radio. The lack of length makes it understandable that you're not going to get any improved signal. All in all, I could only pick up maybe four local channels, which I could have picked up using any piece of wire anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Senzy

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bass boat because i didnt want to drill a hole in the fiberglass. I connected it and strapped it up inside my glove box and it gets good reception. The price was good too, so i would recommend this antenna for anyone who has a boat and wants a hidden antenna.
customer_reviews.author: zachattack

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Very poor performance - antenna received a signal only when I was holding the bare wire at the end, and only in certain orientations. Save your money and buy some sort of amplified antenna such as a window-mount, or an external mast if you can mount it. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Nice antenna
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my boat. Works well. Picks up all the stations in my area. I liked the fact that I didn't have to mount a rigid antenna. Works better when you route the cable away from the other power cables.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D Sechrist

customer_reviews.title: Marine radio
customer_reviews.text: Great price, but marine radio reception still lousy. Looks like I need full antenna. Was worth a try and demonstrated that issue was antenna
customer_reviews.author: Doug McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This product serves its' purpose and we are happy with it. Nothing much to say about a wire antenna--works great!
customer_reviews.author: Penny Blank

customer_reviews.title: Sonic Hub Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my Lowarnce Sonic Hub in my boat. It provides great reception and I get all the FM stations. I works great to run along side the wires inside the hull of your boat so you don't have to drill any extra holes.
customer_reviews.author: Fishinberg

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Poor audio quality. There was crackling on every station, even ones that are always clear using other antennae.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pittman

customer_reviews.title: As Good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This works well in my boat, it isn't perfect as I get occaisional static but for the price I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: antenna gain????
customer_reviews.text: I couldnt tell any difference with this antenna hooked up or nothing at all. cheap to buy easy to throw away. I would recommend to people I dont like.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical but this thing works great. Installed behind dash and got a signal even inside a metal building. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: for the Fusion Ms-RA205
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works well on all bands including the VHF. Could be a few inches longer. I would make this purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bartz

customer_reviews.title: Not good (but cheap)
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 2 days. Doesn't work at all now.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G. Fortnum

customer_reviews.title: didnt work...
customer_reviews.text: Total fail....can barely pick up signal. The wire antenna is worthless. It feels poorly made and doesn't function. It cant even pick up the signal from an FM transmitter placed right next to the device...
customer_reviews.author: D. Le

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend, I get 1 fm station in Dayton Ohio.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it cuz it was cheap and needed it for testing things on my bench. I guess I could have made one, but was in a lazy mood and figured I would just buy it. Poor performance. It contains no ground plane. If you tack a wire a few feet long to the shield at the end and drape it down towards the ground it works infinity better.
customer_reviews.author: Rick K

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a good antenas doesn't pic up station good at all
customer_reviews.author: Randall Kelley

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is just barely better than not having an antenna
customer_reviews.author: eidesign

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Would not pull in any AM stations. Was probably because I was using it in a garage instead of a car.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Epley

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Im using this in my F150 to do away with the outside antenna. Nothing special, it picks up strong signals easily enough. Though once it's hidden and it doesn't pick up a certain station then I guess Im SOL because I cannot constantly keep re-positioning it after it's been tucked away in my truck. Im guessing maybe a powered hidden antenna would do better.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Vowels

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the piece of wire that it replaced
customer_reviews.text: Used in an RV that came with no out side antenna. Works better than the piece of wire that it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Loco

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Installed easy and functions the way it should. Used it in my boat, it seems to pick up a good amount of channels even 10 miles offshore, I have to advise you to install it in a vertical position to achieve the best reception.
customer_reviews.author: Atavism

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: not worth the money. /Get a real antenna . Sorry it does not do well at all.
customer_reviews.author: trudy creager

customer_reviews.title: Not really an antenna
customer_reviews.text: Basically, its just a connector with a single wire coming off of the center conductor. Apparently they have no idea what an antenna is. That being said, for a simple test setup it is probably adequate, just don't try to listen to any stations more than a few miles away.
customer_reviews.author: David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for multiple applications
customer_reviews.text: After reading a review that stated this got a great signal without even mounting the antenna, I decided to give this a shot for my trailer remodel. I had pulled the old antennas off the roof and sealed it all up, so I really didn't want to go poking new holes. I gutted the original defunct dvd/am/fm system and gained a little more cabinet space by using a short single din radio instead. I simply plugged this antenna in and coiled it behind the stereo toward the exterior wall. The reception is great, as good or better than my car antenna.
customer_reviews.author: W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: A piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: I have a boat with a decent clarion radio, but reception was limited to two stations. I noticed an external FM/AM antenna on the back of the unit and ordered this. Wow. I pLugged it in but was not expecting much. WOW! it brought in the stations I wanted and more. Now I have filled in all my presets. What a difference for the price. awesome
customer_reviews.author: David Nadas

customer_reviews.title: Not quite long enough for decent reception
customer_reviews.text: This antenna looks ok however due to the short lead length, it cannot be placed too far from the receiver itself, this means that it is generally shielded by a lot of metal around the dashboard. This does not lead to ideal conditions for AM reception, FM is slightly better, but still poor compared to a properly mounted exterior antenna. This will only get the strongest of stations.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver Jr.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Simple, cheap and works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I used this "pig tail" style, passive antenna with an Infinity head unit mounted in a fairing on my motorcycle. I experimented with antenna lay-out while using the auto-tune feature of my head unit to determine best placement and path inside my fairing. Note: Do NOT let the antenna flop around loose or leave it coiled up. To get best reception you will need to unravel it and experiment with placement. Once I found an acceptable lay-out I taped it down in place. I have not tried powered antennas so I can't compare. But I get pretty good reception from my head unit on my motorcycle with this passive (and super cheap) antenna.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution to our questionable decision to not have purchased our Bass Buggy with a radio. We couldn't see paying $3k or more JUST for a radio to be added to it. My husband researched and found we could do this at a much more reasonable price. We bought the housing, radio, speakers, speaker line and antennae and installed it for under $300 <<<<all name brand marine quality equipment - most pieces from Amazon>>>> saving ourselves $2700 or better and were able to set it up how we wanted it, not the manufacturer standard. The pricing was perfect!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Brooks

product_meta.title: Dual Electronics MAW40 Universal Soft Wire Flexible Long Range Marine Antenna AM/FM Radio Antenna Black
product_meta.description:
Style:Soft Wire Marine Antenna BlackThe Dual Electronics MAW40 Universal Soft Wire Flexible Long Range Marine Antenna AM/FM Radio Antenna Black provides studio quality sound for an unbeatable price. Your flexible mast soft wire long range marine antenna has a range of up to 10 miles to include all Marine Band frequencies making it a must have on the open ocean. Our engineers designed your marine radio antenna to be extremely durable with its soft wire mast so that it can withstand bracing winds while providing you with exceptional sound quality. The weather resistant design includes a sealed rubber exterior that will ensure your marine antenna will not succumb to salt and spray for excellent reception and longevity. The unique design of your marine antenna allows countless connection options with its 40-inch length and Universal Plug. 

Backed by our 1 Year Warranty that guarantees a hassle free experience with excellent customer service.
feature_bullets: EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE & RANGE – your soft mast and long range marine antenna provides a range of up to 10 miles for all Marine Band Frequencies
EXTREMELY DURABLE – given its soft mast this marine radio antenna will provide exceptional sound quality while withstanding bracing winds
WEATHER RESISTANT DESIGN – the sealed rubber exterior ensures the your marine antenna will not succumb to salt and spray for excellent reception and longevity
EXTENDED REACH – your soft wire marine antenna is 40 inches in length and is designed with a Universal Plug to accommodate any marine vessel
2 YEAR WARRANTY – guaranteed high quality and reliability with hassle-free parts and labor warranty with excellent customer service
